abstract.p: Gaviola wins Garden City Breeders' Cup Handicap at Belmont Park (S)

block.p: Gaviola may not be headed for the Breeders' Cup, but the 3-year-old filly achieved a short-term goal yesterday when she won a Grade I stakes and ran her winning streak to six races.

The gray daughter of Cozzene swept to a convincing victory by three lengths in the Garden City Breeders' Cup Handicap at Belmont Park; she has not lost since January. She stayed close to the lead until the homestretch, then cruised to the front under Jerry Bailey and widened her margin over the late-running British filly, Flawly, who rallied from last place to second, ahead of Millie's Quest.

The gray daughter of Cozzene swept to a convincing victory by three lengths in the Garden City Breeders' Cup Handicap at Belmont Park; she has not lost since January. She stayed close to the lead until the homestretch, then cruised to the front under Jerry Bailey and widened her margin over the late-running British filly, Flawly, who rallied from last place to second, ahead of Millie's Quest.

The victory was also the first in a Grade I stakes in 20 years for Gaviola's trainer, Billy Turner. Gaviola ran the mile and an eighth in 1:48 4/5, paid $2.90 for a $2 bet as the heavy favorite and earned $150,000. Turner continued to deny that he would enter his star in the Breeders' Cup Filly and Mare Turf race, which will be run at a mile and a quarter at Churchill Downs on Nov. 4, and which he believes may be too far for Gaviola.
''I would have to say that to get us to the Breeders' Cup, Turner said, they would have to put a hook around me and drag me there.''
